overview_of_class: Recent decades have seen the emergence of "Cold War Studies" as a field of literary and cultural criticism in Anglophone literature particularly. The Cold War likewise played a fundamental role in shaping the creation, translation, and reception of Eastern European writing in the West. But this phenomenon has yet to receive the same kind of scholarly attention, though the consequences for writers and writing on both sides of the Iron Curtain were incalculable. This seminar will address postwar literature East and West by way of the poetry and prose of friends and fellow Nobel Laureates Joseph Brodsky (1940-1996) and Czeslaw Milosz (1911-2004). Other figures who may be discussed include: Boris Pasternak, Anna Akhmatova, Vladimir Nabokov, Zbigniew Herbert, and Wislawa Szymborska.
